page.title: 07THE RED HART INN AT AWRE
page.content: {A GROUP OF GIRLS WENT TO VISIT MR HOWLES OF THE RED HART PUB IN AWRE.THEY WENT FIRST TO THE ONLY BAR.SURROUNDING THE BAR WERE BLACK TABLES WITH MENUS ON THEM.ON THE WALLS WERE A COLLECTION OF MODERN CLOCKS DESIGNED AS SCULPTURES AND MADE BY AN AWRE CRAFTSMAN.THEY WERE FOR SALE.THERE WERE MANY OLD PHOTOGRAPHS OF THE NINETEEN TWENTIES.BEHIND THE BAR IS A CELLAR.ALTHOUGH IT IS VERY COLD THE REAL ALE IS DIFFICULT TO KEEP IN THE SUMMER.WE SAW TWO BIG METAL BARRELS WITH GREEN TUBES LEADING TO THE BAR.MR HOWLE CLEANS THESE EVERY DAY.FROM THE CELLAR STAIRS GO UP TO THE LIVING QUARTERS.THE PUB WAS ORIGINALLY A COTTAGE FOR THE WORKMEN WHO WERE REPAIRING ST ANDREWS CHURCH IN THE EARLY SEVENTH CENTURY.THEN IT WAS USED AS AN ORDINARY HOUSE UNTIL THE NINETEENTH CENTURY.
